Additional $40 was just gone. This never happened before. I was told this was a standard practice??? My money was back in my account 24 hour later, but it was a great inconvenience. Be aware.

review: Uber eats has to be using AI as their support. I won‚Äôt believe otherwise! A few weeks ago, Uber suspended all of my promo codes. I chatted in asking what happened and the agent sent a generic copy and paste message telling me ‚Äúyou‚Äôve breached our terms and can no longer use promo codes‚Äù. I was baffled as I wasn‚Äôt aware of doing something wrong. I order as normal, use promo codes when they are available, haven‚Äôt asked for a refund on anything but a 50cent sauce in probably 6 months or more, and haven‚Äôt really had any issues in general. I was a bit confused by this statement. I asked the agent what term I‚Äôve breached and he ended the chat. I chatted back in, asked the agent what term I‚Äôve breached, and he copied and pasted the exact message the first agent pasted, stating I‚Äôve breached a term. Yes‚Ä¶ I know‚Ä¶ I asked him a second time, which term I breached. He told me due to their privacy laws, he cannot tell me. I asked him what I can do to rectify the situation. He ended the chat. Third time chatting back in. Asked how I can resolve the issue, and if not can Uber close my account. The agent transferred my chat to a specialist who said they would respond within 6-12 hours. Specialist emails me with the same generic ‚Äúyou‚Äôve breached our term‚Äù copy paste message as the first two agents. Are you kidding me? I email back asking for my subscription to be cancelled and account to be closed. A new specialist reply‚Äôs to me saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry you weren‚Äôt able to apply a coupon to your pizza order from 1 month ago. Next time please reach out right away. I can‚Äôt give you any refund on the pizza. I‚Äôm glad I could resolve this for you.‚Äù Is this a joke? Is there a live human on the other end? I can‚Äôt believe they are in business.

review: I recently had a frustrating experience with UberEats that I feel compelled to share. I placed an order for groceries, including 2 pieces of chicken, beef mince, and 2 pounds of beef. However, when my order arrived, I noticed that there was 1 pound of beef missing.Naturally, I contacted UberEats customer support to request a re-delivery of the missing item. To my dismay, the customer support representative informed me that they would not be able to provide a refund or any kind of compensation for the missing beef. This was incredibly frustrating, as I had paid for the full order and expected to receive it in its entirety.To make matters worse, I had included special instructions with my order, but it seemed that the store did not bother to follow them. This left me feeling disappointed and dissatisfied with UberEats' customer support and the overall experience.I believe that when customers place orders and pay for specific items, they should receive exactly what they paid for, and if there are any issues, they should be resolved promptly and fairly. Unfortunately, my experience with UberEats fell far short of these expectations, and I am left feeling frustrated and let down by their customer support.

review: The Uber app consistently fails to deliver my full orders. In the past, missing items were refunded. However, today's order of nine items was completely missing. Customer service, suspecting deceit, refused a refund. This accusation and refusal to resolve the issue have led me to decide against using this app. I suggest you verify with your drivers and stores before casting aspersions on customers. Your service has lost a customer.
name: SH

review: Made a delivery from McDonald's order was wrong and cold. Contact uber eats on the phone 10 minutes to say they will refund me ¬£1.43 the order was ¬£16.39. They will not refund any more than that absolute poor service never using this service again only put one star because you have to

review: It was my first order so I got $20 promo. It was awesome I‚Äôm gonna sound horrible but someone delivered it at five amThanksgiving morning. Didn‚Äôt have to pay to much and I could focus on the delivery guys cut more . You should give more free pro mo for free food out !
name: NM

review: We order through UberEats a lot because Deliveroo is not available in our area. On a regular basis items are missing, completely inedible, or spilled/damaged. Given my experience with UberEats customer service in the past, I don't even bother claiming inedible food anymore and I just deal with it. Missing items, however, is a different story.We order at least a few times a week - sometimes small items like coffees, other times meals. Regularly a few companies (mainly McDonalds and Starbucks) do not send items. I claim them back in the app, and up until a month ago I was refunded for these items. In the last month every order I make requires a PIN, and when I tried to claim back a simple ¬£2.39 donut that was not in the bag, I was unable to. Customer support then told me that "we have seen that a number of orders have received price adjustments or credits" and refused to refund me.Yes, indeed, because they were legitimately missing items. I reached out to their customer support again and again and just get a canned response over and over. No refund, despite them taking money for an item. I feel like I'm being treated as a fraudster when I regularly put up with cancelling drivers, lackluster delivery service, delayed service, and missing or terrible items.We never get any compensation for a bad driver, or a driver who is clearly picking up other orders despite our order being ready. However whenever we have a problem there's radio silence and it's somehow our fault.This is basically theft. How can I prove in a photo something is missing? Shall I take a photo of an empty countertop or an empty hand or bag? Given the amount of orders and money spent, the maths works out that I'd have a higher number of claims. Maybe UberEats needs to look at investigating restaurants which can't seem to fulfill orders or properly update their system when sending the order out that an item was missing, instead of spending time calling customers liars.If UberEats doesn't like providing legitimate refunds, and doesn't want to have decent customer support because they're in what they feel is a high fraud business, then maybe they need to rethink their business altogether.
name: MW

review: The delivery was quick,food was warmüòäCan't complain

review: Always a pleasure to order from Uber eats

They have told me to just google the email for help. Which I‚Äôve tried and tried and can‚Äôt find a email that works. Utter disgrace of a company. I‚Äôm now considering taking legal action against these people

review: Should be zero stars. We placed an Uber Eats order. After the driver got lost multiple times on his way here, we finally tracked him down by walking to where he was. He handed over the bag and was on his way. Lo and behold, it was someone else‚Äôs food. We called him to return. He‚Äôd already delivered our Nando‚Äôs to the people who‚Äôd ordered the prawns that we received. Plus the prawns were supposed to have been delivered 40 minutes prior to our receipt of them. We gave him back the wrong food and tried contacting Uber. They don‚Äôt have a good way of contacting them as all we kept getting was a bot response telling us to enjoy our order. After finally getting hold of someone via chat, they said they‚Äôd reverse the charges. What happened instead is our credit card got charged a second time. Stay away from this shady company and its employees.

review: Appalling service.   Charge you multiple times for multiple orders you never made and wrongly too with no chance of refunds if transactions more than 48hours.  Will not check on fraudulent transactions.  No real way of getting a satisfactory result from them if you got a query.  Have deleted all my info from the wallet in case of fraud and will not be using this fraudulent place again.

review: I have been an Uber Eats customer for a couple of years and have enjoyed the discount promotion and convenience. Uber Eats was great until you need to contact their customer service.  They will have the same response over and over again, and you need to repeat your issue over and over again.A few weeks ago I got an error message when I tried to activate a promotion offer, I contacted Uber Eats help line and was told that my account was restricted from using promotion because I violate their terms and conditions. I had no idea what I did wrong and none of them were able to tell me.  After about a dozen of calls and emails, someone from their priority support team was able to fix it temporary. It went well for a week and then my account was restricted from using promotion again.  After back and forth a few times, I kept getting the same response that system put a restriction to apply promotion because there is a breach of Uber Eats terms and conditions. Again they couldn't find anything to show that I have done anything wrong. I asked for the priority support team and was told there's no such team!!  Finally I got to speak with a Uber manager and was told that they will do an investigation. I asked if someone will get back to me when the investigation is completed. She said no but I can call to follow up. She said they will close my ticket as nothing more they can do. They reassure me that I can still order but without any promotion for the time being.  I was shocked to find that they said they will investigate but will not get back to the customer

review: Didn‚Äôt deliver, rubbish service. Took half an hour or live chat to finally get a refund.  They didn‚Äôt have a driver after an hour and a quarter and expected full payment even though they hadn‚Äôt delivered and kept extending time.  Will not use again.  Deliveroo is far far better.

review: Be aware that Uber Eats takes no responsibility for failed deliveries.  I ordered a meal and waited at home for my delivery with my phone in hand.  After the estimated delivery time, I checked the application and saw that it was marked as delivered.  The only way to contact Uber Eats was via a mail chat system, so I reported that I didn't receive my dinner.I tried to contact the driver and a few minutes later he contacted me, but he  was incomprehensible.  I called the restaurant and they said that they would remake my order and I could come pick it up which is what I did.My complaint to Uber Eats was closed because they said that the driver waited 8 minutes, but he was waiting at the wrong address and he didn't call until long after the delivery when I complained.Why should I have to pay for a delivery to the wrong address?  I am uninstalling the app and I will never use Uber Eats again!

Uber Eats refused to refund money, so I had to speak to my bank to get instigate a claim.  Not clear if I will get the money back ca.¬£50 and the restaurant also unwilling to help/provide resolution.  Uber Eats is fine until something goes wrong. review: Is a joke company for retailer as well as food lovers! Hope customers who orders food re think about reviewing the restaurant.I am a restaurant owner. Unfo, we need this sort of companies to be know in the area when just launched.as people changed their habit to order food via their apps which I understand that is easy and convenient while you are laying on your couch.However, dealing with them as a restaurant owner or ordering food  can be very stressful.Their support line is poor and system dictates you to do all the changes by yourself even fixing the issues that they created such as your menu pricing& promotions listed.When courier delays for picking the order and deliver cold meal. Customer naturally review this negative as restaurant fault. However, in most cases, ubers driver‚Äôs availabilities or they pick another order on the way. So, the food left the restaurant may not be as good as packed or warm enough to be served.Instead, If  few people could call the merchant and order for collection when convenient, You would probabyly get the same item cheaper more effective and warm as it should.I understand if restaurant does not offer delivery service. But, worth to try for value of your money!

I reported the issue, Uber Eats support could not be bothered to respond and left me waiting for days when they are the real issue. Never ordering from this app again!! review: Uber One gave me a $50 discount from one order, and I ended up ordering over $90 worth of food (my average spend per order is between $40-$60).I waited and I waited, then I get a notification "order was delivered early"...where? Uber-moronic (full pun intended) delivery driver ignored my delivery instructions and didn't even bother to verify he was delivering to the right building, nevermind the right person.Almost $100 worth of food stolen. They don't even have a Support phone number or Live Chat for PC you can reach to rectify an issue quickly. Instead you gotta wait 1-2 days for them to respond to your message, receive a bot-generated reply or roll the dice with their Self-Help options of the Order Help section.I got my money back even though I would've preferred to get my FOOD. If I were the paranoid type, I'd think I'm being scammed in order to make me reorder & have to pay the full un-discounted amount. Oh wait, I AM the paranoid type.And that Uber-moron will still be with Ubereats tomorrow and the day after that, so I cancelled my Uber One subscription and signed up for Menulog. Fingers crossed THEY can actually do something right, although their rating ain't higher than this. DOH!

review: Used to order Uber Eats after a long hiatus. The experience was very convenient. It's picks up the nearest restaurant and provides the menu to choose with all the customize options. The delivery was also very prompt. Two points which need work. There is a lot of premium above the price. The price of the dish has a premium. The delivery fee and the tip gets added making the overall experience very unattractive. The second point is that there was a promo applicable but it did not apply. So one can use this service for the convenience at a significant premium

review: I used UberEats for the first the other night. I ordered fast food from Chipotle & paid extra for promptness...the delivery went smoothly & all was well. Because it went so smoothly I decided to order dessert through UberEats... this time the experience made me never want to try again. The driver messaged me that he picked up my order but it was the wrong order & then asked for my code to close out the delivery because he wasn't able to remove it & close it without my code. Well, I said no. I had been charged for the dessert, delivery, & tip & wasn't going to receive what I purchased. After dealing with his many messages & excuse that he didn't speak English & watching the app continue to push my delivery time out (as if he was coming which I knew he wasn't because he said & I was watching him drive other places on the map) I continued to battle your chat bot that wouldn't allow me to do anything as your system still thought it was coming & so I didn't click to cancel for fear that I would be blamed & charged & never get my purchase or a refund. Eventually something in your Chatbot changed (.5hrs later) & I was allowed to chat with a human who said they would cancel the order & I would receive full refund. Thankfully, after eating 45 min of my time on a dessert i never got I did receive a full refund.i do not see myself trying your service ever again. Give 2 stars because it went well first time & I did eventually receive refund,  but not until after I battled chatbot for 45 minutes.

review: Today I received the worst customer service ever. I ordered items from Macdonalds app and they referred me to Uber Eats(who should deliver my order). Address and all the details was correct and I choose the option‚Äùhand to me‚Äù. When I saw on order tracking that driver was near my flat, the driver called me and asked where am I and that he is waiting for me near traffic lights on the main road. I explained the address to him once again and he started screaming at me. He was screaming and talking rude to me. In conclusion, I just went outside to find him, I was walking all along the road but couldn‚Äôt find him. He called me again and continued screaming at me, I told him to cancel my order and request a refund. But he just marked this order as delivered and disappeared. After that I was calling to Uber Eats customer support and told them all what happened, as a result they just said they can‚Äôt give me a refund because it was an order from Macdonalds and the fact that Uber Eats cooperated with them to deliver my order can‚Äôt make any change to it. So be careful and if your drivers name is Ganiu Mobolaji Y. leave a complaint on him. He‚Äôs extremely rude and unsuitable to provide a good customer service.

review: This is an awful experience with Ubereats. The food that we ordered from a restaurant nearby was cold and inedible. Me and my husband could not eat it. We complained but they refunded  around ¬£4+ The delivery man apparently had to pickup another item from a dessert shop on his way;  the gps tracking was showing up 5 mins away from our house which took him 40 mins to reach Initially, we called the restaurant and asked them to cancel the order but the man was so rude that he disconnected the phone while my husband was explaining the reason. review: We ordered a ¬£47 McDonald's order & awaited delivery. The time on the app kept changing re:delivery time. Then we got a msg telling us that the driver had gone home & another was being sent to the area! We rang McDonald's to ask if the food could be prepared freshly as almost an hour had passed by now. The staff member at the store took our order number down incorrectly on 4 occasions & claimed that he couldn't find it.....yet a manager was shouting in the background, telling him to say that cos "we ain't f-ing cooking it again". We finally got the order after 98 minutes & of course it was all freezing cold, Mcflurries & milkshakes melted. We rang Uber Eats & were told we'd immediately get a refund & it could take 15 days to show in the account. Fast forward to now & still no refund and when we ring in to complain, we are told it is not an Uber Eats problem or to ring McDonald's cos its their fault or they can't understand us.......and they refuse to put a manager on the phone or even put a request in for one to call back. Uber Eats are lying THIEVING scum.

review: If I could give zero stars, I would. I order for my organization all the time from various companies, and this is by far the worst. Never again. Most recent disappointment: I placed an order for pick up on a later date. When I checked the app the morning of my order, there was nothing there. I called the restaurant; nothing in their system. So I had to pivot quickly to feed my team. Three weeks later, Uber Eats charged me the full amount of the order that did not exist in the app. There was no email confirmation after thinking I completed the order days in advance of pick up, so I figured I missed a step and didn't complete it in the first place. I spoke with 4 reps today, all of whom sited a 48 hour policy to contact them. But why would I bother if there was no record of an order, on my end or with the restaurant? Complete scam, bunch of crooks. Never again.

review: This should be zero stars. Made order, rider arrived, but as he was trying to explain (with very limited English) that the order had spilled, the entire order fell out of the bag and on to the dirty ground. Messaged Uber Eats through the app with photos and a screen flashed up to say the full amount paid would be refunded.  A few hours later, with no refund confirmation email and the full transaction still pending, I repeated the process and this time a screen flashed up stating a partial refund would be issued and this time a refund email was sent. Partial refund? For no service and nothing delivered? Are you kidding me? That is essentially theft. Since then no further responses from UberEats to any of my messages and it is impossible to actually call and speak to anyone to resolve this. An honest, trustworthy company would at least have an option to speak to a human. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

review: order food from Kohinoor with Uber Eats. Even though the restaurant was very close to my hotel, the driver took a long time and delivered to a wrong hotel. I called the restaurant and they personally delivered me the food without any extra charge. It obviously cost them extra for food and I truly appreciated their customer service. I tried to contact Uber Eats again next day to get the restaurant reimbursed for the extra food. They refused to take responsibility for it. Totally awful. Will never use a Uber again.

review: Absolutely terrible! Doesnt even deserve 1 star! Multiple times I've ordered food an hour before a place closes and after waiting forever the app says that they're looking for another driver or the restaurant is closed and yet I've still charged for the food that never arrived. At that point its too late to get food from anywhere else and I'm out of money. I tried to accept the first couple "mistakes" and assume it wouldn't happen again but then it does! They don't even call or anything and then when you try to get help you're sent to a chatbot that gives you the runaround and says that you can cancel the order but will still be charged. It even has a "why am I still being chargwd?" Option which I clicked and the response was "would you still like to cancel your order?" When I finally got to talk to a "person" it was clearly still a bot and literally ignored half of my messages. It wasn't until I started typing refund over and over, that I finally got to chat with a real person that did refund me but didnt listen to any of my concerns and actually ended the chat while i was typing. Still went hungry and still wasted time and a lot of energy. Never again.

review: This is not the first time this has happened where my food delivery was supposed to be arriving and was cancelled without any compensation. Not only did I not receive my order but it was then too late to order from anywhere else and the customer service response was to repeatedly say that I ‚Äúwas not charged.‚Äù Uber Eats clearly does not care about retaining customers. It took approx 10 mins for them to find a new driver, during which time I was trying to cancel my order or change it to pick-up. I couldn‚Äôt do this as Greggs had accepted the order.I then manager to find a chatbot, which confirmed that I couldn‚Äôt cancel the order because it had been prepared by the restaurant, and that I‚Äôd be charged full price if I cancelled. So I didn‚Äôt cancel. The food arrived at 5.40pm. One of the meals was completely left out and, of course, what was delivered was stone cold due to it having been prepared over an hour earlier. Ubereats refunded for the one meal, but nothing for lateness, coldness or downright negligence.App is about to be deleted - waiting for a food delivery from Uber is just more stressful than it‚Äôs worth.

review: Your delivery service is shocking! Give a time for it to be delivered and then change it for a hour later. review: Awful experience drivers marking food as delivered when it‚Äôs not and still not able to get a refund without contacting bank. I sacked Uber eats a while ago but thought I‚Äôd give kfc delivery a try, big mistake that‚Äôs also Uber. Rang up after waiting an hour to be told driver was in the kfc, next minute order cancelled and kfc still take the money. Uber are a prime example of Big business‚Äôs getting away with daylight robbery
name: Carl 'Buddy' Loadwick

review: Uber Eats are sham and a scam. Uber Ones is a monthly (or annual) ostensibly premium subscription fee service. Except there is a steep minimum order to qualify for the free delivery and discounted service that you pay additionally for monthly/annually.They also routinely let you down but making you wait for over an hour (this is often the service given to those who aren't Uber One subscribers) only to be told there is no driver available. One time it was almost two hours after wasting my time that they basically said, 'Sorry, no dice'.Drivers are often listed as being in modes of transport they're not using, and frequently the person delivering does not match the photo. Recently I was informed it was an asian woman on a push bike, only for an old asian guy to turn up. At least I got my order, but still, it's unprofessional.Getting a refund from Uber Eats is often problematic. You always have to jump through hoops via the app before you might get a refund, and often they refuse to issue one. So, I suggest that anyone who does considering paying in advance (because that's the modus operandi of this alleged service), that they use their credit card, and block any payments where Uber Eats aren't willing to refund for issues.Some drives steal your order. I literally had a driver turn up tonight with none of the three meals I ordered, just the drinks. When asked where the meals were, he replied, 'Sorry, they only gave me this bag', and as if to somehow prove this beyond doubt, showed the inside of the insulated bag. Because he couldn't have possibly removed the meal bag(s) and left them inside his car before knocking on my door.Lastly, Uber Eats is a strange faceless organisation, and there poor service underpins this cold, distant impersonal business. Avoid, trial Uber One, but never subscribe to/pay for it.
name: Frank84

review: 'm feeling incredibly frustrated with the customer service I've been receiving. It seems like every time I face an issue with my orders, I end up spending a lot of time seeking help, but to no avail. Each visit to the help center leaves me feeling like I'm just running in circles, without getting any closer to a solution. It's been a really terribel experience.

I wanted to order food before a concert and the driver took way longer than expected, then stayed in one random spot on the map for ages before coming to me. It showed he picked up the order on the map supposedly but when he got to mine he claimed to be lost so I went to meet him downstairs of the apartment complex. Then he proceeds to tell me with broken English that he doesn‚Äôt have my food because the ‚Äúapp never showed him where to pick it up?‚Äù He ‚Äútried‚Äù calling uber support but it said his number was blocked which was a great red flag. Basically he stole my food but because he marked it as delivered and he did pick it up (for himself), uber customer support refuses to refund me which I think is outrageous. review: The delivery has been as expected with my first and second order with UberEats. So best advice is compile a list and get as much as you can order at one time, makes the delivery cost go down per item, same end cost. It has been great so far, just giving good solid advice from my short experience.

review: Absolutely shocking customer service!Ordered from the McDonald‚Äôs app, driver was about 30 mins away from the restaurant and took him about 1hr to pick up order, called up to ask what was happening and if I could cancel, man on phone said food was now on way so couldn‚Äôt cancel and said to call back if any problems with the order. Food arrived freezing cold way to cold to eat, Icecream melted that it was now just pure milk, drink spilt everywhere all over straws and other drink, had to bin the food as it was the disgusting and cold that if was to eat probably would of gotten ill! Called Uber eats back up like the man said to do, first women couldn‚Äôt find any of my information as she was obviously typing in wrong even though she told us they we were the ones saying it wrong? (It‚Äôs my details I can‚Äôt say it wrong) called back to find someone else second women found me and put me on hold for 10 minutes to then come back and tell me that they aren‚Äôt going to refund, no partial refund, no credit nothing. For food that was inedible? I told the women that is it ridiculous and she told me she understood, she obviously didn‚Äôt understand as I would of had a refund, I then asked to speak to a manager he then said they only do refunds if I cancelled the order before restaurant accepts?! Like what the hell? I told him I called up before to cancel due to waiting and then couldn‚Äôt as it was then on its way, he said the same thing over and over which was just complete bloody rubbish. So next time if I order of Uber eats and my food is cold I must remember to order and then cancel before I get my food because of course I will no what my food is going to be like, bloody ridiculous. No customer service, they don‚Äôt care for anything except for everyone‚Äôs money they are scamming. Don‚Äôt use, use Deliveroo instead. I am going to try and take it further through my bank.

review: Don't do it. You can't review restaurants - even though you see some reviews listed - they are usually just good ones. There is no way to write one of your own, so I don't know where they get the ones you see. Nor is there any way listed to contact Uber customer service, even though I belong to Uber One. You seem to have to go through their twitter page, and I'm not joining that mess just to contact them. You shouldn't have to search all over the place to find a way to contact them, it should be right on the app page and easy to find. It's a rip-off and a joke. Most of my orders come botched. Even when rating a restaurant with the thumbs up or down, they really don't let you give an accounting of why you're giving a thumbs down, they just give a few suggestions from which to choose. The prices are way too high, restaurants have really taken advantage of pandemic pricing, it's gross. Even though I realize Uber doesn't set the prices, the service itself is so crappy it's not worth joining. They are uninterested in whether you have a good experience, and since that is the essence of customer service, I highly recommend you stay clear.

review: I had an incredibly frustrating experience with Uber Eats recently. I ordered food from Spice Lounge in Erdington to be delivered to Good Hope Hospital for lunch. A female driver was assigned to the job, and initially, I could track her progress. However, the app suddenly stopped working with no notifications or alerts. After restarting my phone, I was shocked to see that the app claimed the food had been delivered, even though I received no communication or confirmation.Desperate for a solution, I contacted Spice Lounge, but they insisted they were not responsible since the food had been picked up. Following their advice, I reached out to Uber support through the app. Unfortunately, my interaction with their support was disheartening, as I received what seemed to be automated, robotic replies. The response continually asserted that the driver waited for 8 minutes and, as a result, I was ineligible for a refund.Now, I find myself out approximately ¬£17 for two Biryani dishes that I never received. To make matters worse, I had to work a shift without any food since there were no other nearby options I could trust for a timely delivery. The overall experience left me deeply dissatisfied with Uber's service. It's disheartening that the company relies on automated AI technology for customer interactions, providing generic responses and showing a lack of accountability.I strongly caution against using Uber Eats and similar services. It seems they prioritize their profits over customer satisfaction, offering subpar service and inadequate customer support. Save yourself the trouble and expense by collecting your own food, ensuring a more reliable and satisfying experience. I, for one, will not be using any Uber service in the future and will discourage my friends and family from doing so as well. waiting for receipt, will update later

review: Im submitting as this rubbish has occurred more than once in a short space of time and refuse to accept this as coincidence. See screenshots of my most recent abysmal experience. I order some food from Burger King via Uber eats app. Around 40 minutes later the rider calls me and says ‚Äúthe restaurant says they dont have your order‚Äù at which point I‚Äôm asking ‚Äúwhat does that mean for me and what are expecting me to do about it since I don‚Äôt work for your company‚Äù he then says ‚Äúone second‚Äù and hangs up‚Ä¶ below is a transcript of the bizzarre ordeal with customer service‚Ä¶this is how uber eats treats customers, so god knows how their employees are treated. 2 hours later I have a deliveroo order instead. This is not the first time this sort of horrendous customer treatment has happened from uber eats so I assume there are real problems with this whole operation. I urge all to submit their terrible experiences unless we are all growing tolerant of the execs of these big companies treating the public like this whilst laughing all the way to the bank.Advisor 1: Hi (my name)Me: Your driver has contacted me saying that the restaurant i ordered from dont have my orderI have already waited far too longI need you to find out from this restaurant what they are doingAdvisor 1: I'm sorry to hear about your issue. Please bear with me for a few minutes while I pull up the details for you.Me: ThanksAdvisor 1: Thanks for waiting. I'm going to try contact the restaurant partner and will get back to you in two minutesMe: Ok thanksAdvisor 1: I am still trying to connect, I hope to update you in the next 2 minutes.Advisor 1: I have tried contacting the restaurant partner but unfortunately, I am unable to get in touch with them.Advisor 1: I've gone ahead and cancelled this order. Rest assured you were not charged for this order.Advisor 1: Is there anything else I can help you with?Me: Did you contact your delivery employee?Me: Hello?Advisor 1: I confirm that your order has been canceled and you are not charged for if.Thank you for your understanding and for reaching out to support. Have a nice day ahead.Me: You didnt answer my questionCHAT ENDED BY ADVISOR 1(Notice the answer avoided so out of sheer frustration i tried again with a different one‚Ä¶) Advisor 2: I can see that the order is mark as cancelled and you're not charged for it.Me: Hi, one of your employees cancelled my order and I did bot ask for thatMe: I only wanted to know what has happened?Me: Nowhere in my messages did I say i wanted to cancel my order. I said that your delivery guy called me saying that burger king dodnt have my orderMe: I saw a message saying the order was with the rider, so did you check that the rider managed to get the order in the end?Advisor 2: I understand that this has been inconvenient and that you were not hoping for this outcome, but I appreciate you letting us know about this.Advisor 2: I understand that this has not been a great experience, but please know that this is not a regular occurrence and I hope your next experience would be a better one.Advisor 2: You can place a new order now.Me: All I want is an answer to my question. What has happened please?Me: Its important for companies to be transparent with customers. So it is reasonable for you to explain what has happened‚Ä¶Advisor 2: Your order was cancelled by one of our agent without asking from you.Advisor 2: This was indeed not the type of experience we strive for, but there can be unusual situations like these which are contrary to the expectations.Me: I know that, but did the rider actually manage to get my order?Me: Can you find out please?Advisor 2: I understand that this is not the outcome you were hoping for. Unfortunately, I am unable to look into this matter any further.Thank you for reaching out to support. Have a nice day ahead.CHAT ENDED BY ADVISOR 2Advisor 3: Hi (my name)Me: This whole chain is going to be posted publicly unless I get an answer to my questionAdvisor 3: Sorry to hear about thatAdvisor 3: I can see your order has been already marked as canceled nad you will be not charged for this order.Me: This is ridiculousAdvisor 2: Rest assured there is no charge for the order, But if you do see any charge right now than please know that the charge you are seeing is likely an authorization hold and will release back to your account shortly.Me: Are you an actual person?Advisor 3: I will immediately forward this information to the dedicated team who will come back to you as soon as possible.Chat transferred: This conversation has been sent to another team. An agent will do their best to answer within 6 to 12 hours.What do we make of this? Are these people clicking on pre-populated answers?? Or even worse, are UE using AI even when the customer believes they are talking to an agent? Maybe a freedom of info request may answer?

review: I used uberEats to order Nando's food. I filed a complaint, and the chatbot replied that I was charged for cancelling my order, which I did not do, and that there would be no refund. Unsatisfied customer because I paid for food that I never received but was charged for. I am the type of customer who will always walk away without a fight, and UberEATS has let me down on a few occasions, which has really irritated me these days. review: I ordered from a local restaurant from Uber Eats for a scheduled delivery about an hour and a half in advance.   The restaurant is only a 10-15 minute drive from my home. An hour before the delivery window approached, I received a notification that the restaurant accepted the order. I called the restaurant. They said there was no future time on the order and they would begin working on it. I asked them to delay it. They called me back a few minutes later and said that the Uber driver would be arriving 40 minutes in advance of the delivery window to pick up the order and they needed to start work on it. I told them I was going to cancel the order.When I got on the app, I was able to cancel the order, but I was informed that because the restaurant had accepted the order and began preparing it, I would be charged so the restaurant could be paid.There was no way Support were going to refund the monies.The problem as I saw it was the app or the Uber Eats process of releasing the order prematurely. I didn't want it early for a cold dinner. There is no way for me to complain to Uber for this issue, thus I must resort to this review to complain and hope that they will fix the process. I won't be using Uber again.

review: I was at home waiting for my delivery yesterday. Then received a phone call saying your delivery person is trying to reach you. There was no sound from him in the call so went into the messages, I described where I was living again. He could not find the place, then I heard a motorbike sound. After a couple of seconds I wrote I think I heard you. I looked through the balcony and saw a motorbike. It was pretty far from the building where I live. He said "Come down and get it" It was very rude but I did not care. ƒ± said you seem like you are at the wrong place but I will come down anyway. I immediately went down and saw that it was not him again immediately. I have called him multiple times and he did not pick up. He has taken a photo of the order standing in the middle of a random street. I have searched for my order on the streets in cold for half an hour. I could not find it. Please could you tell me if is this normal? It is acceptable? You are saying that the delivery partner tried to contact you and waited long enough. ?No he has not. He has not. This is exactly what happened. No this is not normal. I have done my best, I did nothing wrong. I am furious. I will never ever use Uber Eats or any Uber app again.

review: After taking my order for immediate delivery, they cancelled and said the restaurant was too busy. So I extended the delivery time by 30 mins. Again, they said the same thing. So I extended it to 2.5 hours later. The order went through and I began to get notification push messages. Then 20 minutes before my delivery time, Uber Eats cancelled the order. I called the restaurant where I eat all the time. I spoke to the manager and she checked with the kitchen and order desk and NO ORDER EVER CAME IN. So I walked there to get my food. I called Uber Eats and they started by saying the merchant cancelled the order. LIARS! I asked for proof of this and they said they can't provide anything. This is among the WORST customer service and company I have ever seen. Which is why 35,000 other reviewers here have given them 1 star. They offered me a $10 credit! Hahahahah I told them to stick it up their ass. Deleted App forever.

The delivery fee was still at $0.49, but Uber doubled their income!!!  I ended up paying $51.00 for something that normally costs $23.00.  Rip off!!

I tried to call back and he would not answer nor respond to my messages. The next day I called customer service and they said they could not give me a refund since my order pin was verified. By the way I never gave the guy my pin. This is the kind of company that doesn‚Äôt hold their employees accountable and could care less about customer service. review: I've only used UberEATS twice and each time I had to get a refund through the most conveluted support process I've ever used. There is no way to directly contact agents through the app, which refused to aknowledge my issue. Once I Googled a support number, they refused to take my call on the basis that I had no pending orders, so I had to make a call through Uber itseslf and ended up on hold/being transferred for two hours. Instance one, Uber claimed my delivery had arrived but it had never been picked up. Instance two, it was delivered to the wrong place (different resteraunts for each instance), and they refused to give me a refund initially. Each time has been stressful and irritating, neither time did I end up with food. I don't know why I ever assumed ordering through a third party would make things easier, this is clearly a scam, especially because they take a cut of the resteraunt's money. Do not use this app, order directly instead and save yourself the hassle when things go wrong, or even if they go right.

review: Last night i ordered foods through this app, had to wait longer than expected, the status on the app said that its waiting for a partner to pick it up from the restaurant where we ordered the food, every 10 minutes, the estimated time of delivery got delayed for 10 minutes, and the status didnt change. After 1,5 hour waiting, i texted the guy who is supposed to deliver the foods, and got no response. Then the restaurant called me saying that the delivery partner didnt show up and if i would like to come and pick up the foods myself. 15 min later, I saw the new notification coming from my order saying that part of the order is cancelled, which part? No details! The status keeps saying that its still waiting for the delivery partner to pick up the order. Then i was called by the cs of uber eats she explained that possibly the delivery guy had technical issue blabla and told me that they cancelled my order (so after 2 hours), she assured me that i will get my money refunded (oh what a surprise) isnt it a good news? Then she said, but dont worry you still come to the restaurant to pick up your order? Haha after 2 hours you waited and they cancelled your order and then telling you as if its a rewards to get your money refunded and then tell you to pick up your food, this is a joke, if i want or can pick it up at the restaurant why would i bother to order via ubereats? Completely missing the point of their own service line? We didnt pick the order because its already around 9pm and its raining and we have no bike. So yes, how to compensate my wasted 2 hours time other than getting my money back? Such a bad experience and bad customer service.

review: Today I ordered a sainsburys shop and got someone elses cheaper co-op shop instead so put in a complaint and the reply was they couldn't help me because I have a number of issues like this on my account!! the reason i have other issues and refunds is because of either messing up my order or the worst one the delivery driver let go of the bags before i could grab them which resulted in 4 pints of milk exploding all over and ruining my shopping and balcony ..... today was the last straw I will never ever use uber again and lucky I decided to go through paypal and got an instant refund and I suggest to anyone else who gets refused a refund or the right delivery delivered does the same ......

review: First and last time I'll use Ubereats.  Food was running 20 minute behind the latest expected time, no big deal it happens, but we were listening out for it.  Got a phonecall with an automated message saying Ubereats driver was trying to contact me, but no option to speak the driver?!My partner went straight out the front door to look for him but no sign.  I got an e-mail receipt 30 seconds later saying the food have been delivered to number 7, I live at number 34 and you could clearly see the correct address on the initial order.  It wasn't in the garden of number 7 either (just across the road from us so we'd have seen a car pull up if that's where it had been left). and the photograph doesn't match the garden of where it was supposedly delivered to.  Despite having photographic evidence of the food being dumped at the wrong address and the driver recording it as being delivered to the wrong house number, Ubereats still refused to refund!Edit: If you order through Paypal you can't open a dispute if you don't receive your order.  Also Uber set up an automated payment on my Paypal, which they didn't cancel once they'd already taken the initial payment, so beware of them taking duplicate transactions.  I'll be closing my account and double checking my bank statements as I don't trust this awful, dishonest company.  Fortunately I was able to get a refund from the restaurant as we order from them regularly (unfortunately they stopped taking orders through Deliveroo hence using Ubereats).  However, I'm shocked at the appalling service from Ubereats, especially being accused of lying and giving the wrong address/phone number on the order. Also apparently it's perfectly fine to dump food in random people's gardens and call it a delivery service! Never had a comparable experience in my years of using Just Eat and Deliveroo.

review: I ordered from uber yesterday evening, when the driver messaged me to say he was outside, my colleague checked and there was no one outside. Both my colleague and myself waited outside for about 15-20 the driver never turned up, I sent the driver various messages but still nothing. I complained to uber and even advised them to check the drivers messages plus the miss calls. The only response I got was the driver attempted to deliver so on that basis I was still charged and they will not give me a refund. Personally I will never be using them again. Bunch of cons

review: Ordered my weekly groceries through the Uber Eats app. A driver phoned me and said someone had already taken the order and delivered it to me, but I haven't received anything. He just cancelled it on his part to give to another driver. Rang Waitrose and they said to call Uber. Rang Uber and they said there was a miscommunication but that my groceries were definitely getting delivered. A driver called me to ask for the pin code saying they need it to cancel the order. I gave it to him thinking they would sort it out. I asked him what's going to happen next, is he gonna reorder, are the groceries with him, is he coming to my house? He wouldn't answer properly. He put the phone down and then blocked my caller ID. Reached out to customer support in the Uber Eats app and I'm still waiting for a response 1 hour later, still hungry, still no groceries on my doorstep.

review: They used to have really good customer service but it is now one of the worst experiences I have ever had. It takes ages to get through to a human and then you are met with utter disregard, and individuals who ignore your points, do not address what you are saying or asking for and are wholly unhelpful. My order was repeatedly delayed when they couldn‚Äôt find a driver despite my food being ready which then sat there for over 40 minutes. I asked them to cancel since they couldn‚Äôt deliver it and I was just told to keep waiting and eventually someone will bring it. By this point I had given up and started making myself dinner it had been so long. I continued to ask to cancel and be refunded but the agent was like speaking to a brick wall continually spewing the same rhetoric lacking any real apology or empathy for their shoddy service. He attempted to blame the driver and when I was allocated a driver the app told me that they were actually going to complete another delivery first before bringing my food. By this point my food was surely rock hard but again the customer service agent didn‚Äôt care and when I asked for their name to include in my review they promptly ended the chat with me and didn‚Äôt answer any of my remaining concerns.  By far the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever seen. Their username was msidiq1. Needless to say, my food showed up cold and rock hard and went straight in the bin. (Pad Thai with the noodles had formed an inseparable block). I once again flagged this and was given some money off but still had to pay ¬£5 for this inedible block and the time I wasted speaking to their shoddy customer service agent. Beyond belief!! If they simply cancelled the ¬£12 order and refunded me when it hasn‚Äôt left the restaurant this could have all been avoided.

I think its time to cut on using ubereats very bad

review: 4 times in the past 2 weeks my order got cancelled because they failed to find a rider to deliver the order. I live fairly central london, the restaurant is within a few miles. 4 times. After calling the restaurant, he assures me that it's being prepared and will be delivered. and at 1AM I receive a message that my order could not be delivered. No open restaurants left to order anything. They didn't even bother sending me an automated email to apologize. it is UN-F-BELIEVABLE that these guys still manage to survive.Deliveroo is not great either but probably 100 times better than these guys. At least you find a customer service agent who doesn't lie to you when you have an issue with an order.

review: Uber eats is a great service but can be rather expensive when including the service fee, delivery fee and the obvious extra price hikes on food in comparison to ordering directly from the takeaway. One thing that they have always offered though is discount codes and promotions sent via email promotions, unfortunately it seems that recently these promotions are all pure marketing tactics which include ‚Äúfake‚Äù discounts.I have recently received no fewer than four separate offers for discounts on food delivery with the latest being 50% off which even tempted me to join Uber one to save a little on deliveries as the offer could be used 5 times. Luckily I didn‚Äôt as the promotion along with the previous three is available to use at no stores. After searching for a support number I contacted Uber eats support via X where a team member was happy to help, I confirmed my account details and sent proof of my payment card and eagerly awaited a response. After no reply after a few hours I messaged again‚Ä¶ and again‚Ä¶ and again to continuously be ignored for several days now. I have been searching for contact details on how to make an official complaint regarding false advertisement and marketing but have failed so far, I shall continue to search for any kind of contact details while I enjoy a delicious take away delivered by Deliveroo.

Then i got an automated response and couldn't talk to a real person, the automated response sorry order not eligible for refund, well that shouldn't be possible if their driver didnt deliver the food.

review: Absolute scam. We ordered McDonald's via the McDonald's App, Uber Eats delivers. We ordered at 7pm, our receipt says 7.02pm so that's when they started making the food and milkshakes. The tracker said 3 times it was looking for a new driver. This went on until 7:30 when a driver was finally assigned, saying it would be delivered at 7:45 because he had to deliver to someone else first. Obviously the food arrived stone cold and milkshakes melted. We phoned customer service who were no help at all and seem to think because they delivered within 55 minutes there's not an issue. We paid ¬£27 for food and drinks that were inedible. They said they can't refund us, get in touch with McDonald's. McDonald's said it's Uber Eats that need to refund. Round and round in circles we went, Uber Eats refused a refund because they're following their ridiculous "policy". Worst company I've ever dealt with, will never be using them again. 55 minutes for food and milkshakes to sit out, really? Get a grip you money grabbing scammers.

They were patronising towards my mother; they asked me to read the order number out but when trying to see which number it was my mother beat me to it. They kept saying she was an intelligent woman over and over, just for reading a number out, so we didn‚Äôt appreciate that. They clearly didn‚Äôt have many brains cells asking me to repeat my name and number numerous times it became a joke, clearly not listening and just reading off his cue cards. I also read the driver can drop your order any time, they are just polling for drivers like for taxis. Totally unreliable system.Update - so I got my food and the bill with the times. review: Awful customer service and awful staff. This company deserves 0 stars. Their staff are rude and inexperienced. Getting hold of them is literally impossible. The restaurant I ordered from was taking orders but was clearly closed. Not only did me and my family not eat that night, they robbed us of ¬£30 quid and they offered no support or apology. They are completely morally wrong. I would avoid using this service like the plague. Deliveroo and JustEat are much better.

review: Awful service. I ordered a McDonald‚Äôs via their app. An hour later the food arrived, but not before it was delivered to the wrong address. After 25 minutes of trying to communicate to the driver- the food was delivered to me at the correct address. By this time not only was  the food stone cold, it was also a wrong order. When I called their CS number. I was told that the food was delivered satisfactory according to him. That was the end of it.It would appear that Uber Eats is more than happy to take your money and as long as they deliver something. It doesn‚Äôt matter what it is- or even the correct order. Everyone I have spoken to were rude, unhelpful and patronising. I‚Äôd steer clear from ordering. Especially in the Stamford area! Appalling service.

review: Company failed to deliver 4 items from a food order, when I contacted customer services they said they would refund the missing drinks but could not refund the charge for condiments despite being charged for them, call handler stated it was policy. review: Just ordered lunch from mac ds on the app .I normal use just eat much better service .My food arrived stone cold absolutely disgusting .Went on to the app which suggested I call uber eats which I did .On looking at the order the time it was dispatched was 12.35And delivered 1.35I live within 5 min of store .Uber eats refused to refund me and told me I must speak to macdonalds if the food was cold .I explained the reason it was cold was because the driver had been driving round with it for an hour doing other delivery's. I called macdonalds and explained to them the situation , I was told although they have a policy each driver can only take two orders from store , they collect orders from all the other surrounding eateries at the same time .So uber think it's acceptable to deliver food stone cold , it's clear its not macdonalds fault .Don't use uber better to use Just eat if you like your food hot .I even tipped the driver! Shame on you uber for not refunding or replacing order .

review: Awful service, took over an hour to deliver food from a place 2 minutes away. SHOCKING!!!

review: I ordered food for the family for ¬£70.21 in total on Sunday, got a txt about 40 mins later saying food had been delivered when it hadn't as I was in our front room amd we also have a RING bell that records people. I called the drivers number and called it several times. I even went to the neighbours to see perhaps it was delivered there. No response from driver. I contacted the restaurant which said I have to contact Uber. I called uber eats on 2 numbers the store gave me and after 25 mins of explaining the lady tells me I have to respond to a txt she will send on the app. I responded to the txt explaining again what happened. I got a txt back a day later saying the order is not eligible for a refund because the driver arrived at destination and waited. That's a clear lie and I have the evidence that no one arrived and I was in the front room where the door is. I eventually ordered same from Deliveroo. Won't be using uber eats anymore. But will continue to go after my money from them.

review: Ordered my girls pancakes for them not to be delivered. Rang UberEats to which they advised they will not refund me. Wouldn‚Äôt even let me respond and hung up on me. Absolutely disgraceful customer service. Will never use again or recommend.

review: Absolutely shocking. Do not use. We had a big order from Macdonalds on Saturday night. They delivered drinks and missed out 5 meals. Not sure how you miss these out. Raised complaint straight away and now saying they won‚Äôt refund because over 48 hours. It is their fault it has taken so long.
name: MI

review: I used Uber to order a set menu from KFC (New Lynn) that included 16 pieces of chicken. A number of chickens that are not usually counted.  I was hungry so I started eating right away. That day, I looked into the bucket and saw a lot of chicken wings. I got annoyed and counted how many chicken wings there were, and I found out that the total number of chickens was 14. With the mindset that I had to contact Uber quickly, I stopped eating even though I couldn't even eat two, took a picture to keep as evidence, and started writing a complaint. Meanwhile, the chickens, chips and potato gravy I ordered were all cold. It's winter, so the food gets cold while it's being delivered to your house. Can't you imagine what the hot food will be like after all the time it took to take out all the chickens in the bucket, arrange them side by side so they can be seen clearly in the photo, take pictures, and write the application form. I was so irritated that all desire to eat disappeared. I threw away all that food. And asked for a refund. The above is all included in the message I wrote while requesting help from Uber. Uber's response came the next day, not the same day. The result was truly shocking. Refund NZ$7.41. Could it be that the price of two chickens is NZ$7.41? So refund this price??  Uber's action to end the situation by only returning the price of two chickens. This is so absurd. I ended up violating my right to enjoy the food I ordered using Uber, but they don't seem to feel sorry at all. Don't try to solve problems like this, where consumers are harmed and where it is not the consumer's fault at all. Don't fool consumers like this. NZ$7.41?Take this money and buy two chickens for yourself!
name: NK

review: The food arrived at the given time with no unexpected surprises.As I live in an apartment timing was important to meet with the delivery person at the recorded time.I was constantly advised of the location of the deliverer. Timing is important to accommodate our very busy lives.

I explained that my money had been taken but there was no delivery and the agent said there was no order and closed the chat. I tried again with another agent, same result. It is what it is, thank you for reading my spiel. <3 yours truly Daiyaan.

You have to get cross with them before they will agree to put a ‚Äòpromotion‚Äô on your account which will enable you to reorder the items for free.6. The promotion will not work because their website says that it cannot process your order.7. When you call Uber Eat back to complain that the order won‚Äôt process, they will put you on hold for almost ten minutes before transferring you to a recorded message asking you if they have dealt with your query. When you select 2 for No, the line goes dead.8. When you call back to complain about the appalling level of customer service, they tell you to take a screenshot of the message that prevents you from reordering. They will then send you an email that you can reply to with your concerns about customer service, requests for a refund and an attached copy of the screenshot.9. When you try to follow the instructions given, you find that you cannot take a screenshot of the message because they have suddenly disabled your account!10. When you reply to their email with your complaint, sans the screenshot, they will reply to tell you that they can only deal with your complaint by telephone!11. You will feel so incensed that you want to leave a bad review on their website, but they don‚Äôt actually have any means of online feedback.12. You will feel so incensed that you go online and search for other people who have had similar experiences. You will find a lot of people on both sides of the pond who have had similar and worse experiences, including non-deliveries and assaults from drivers! Also, you will find cases of people being promised refunds for significant amounts, but never receive them.In short, my advice to you is this:  I RECOMMEND THAT YOU DO NOT USE UBER EAT, OR ANY BRAND RUN BY THE SAME COMPANYThe above has been my experience today and their attitude to customers is so poor and so rude that I feel compelled to do something I rarely do, on principle. I‚Äôm going to put an üò° on this post!
name: Nada Higman

review: The worst customer service you can imagine. The person has zero interest understanding the customer issue and just copy and paste ‚Äúwe are so sorry‚Ä¶‚Äù In 2023, AI would have done a much better job.  It is not a platform that takes care of customers, it‚Äôs fairly speaking is also a challenging business model.  I don‚Äôt think it is working especially during rush hours.  Don‚Äôt expect your food to be on time or the customer service to understand your issue and solve it for you.

review: First morning in new house with 100‚Äôs of boxes to open so placed a breakfast order and tea and cake for mid morning. Left a note on order explaining for driver about house being a new build, near the entrance and on the right.I received a phone call from an irate driver claiming I had given him wrong directions. He repeatedly asked where I was and I couldn‚Äôt tell him other than the info he already had. After nearly 4 minutes of his abuse I hung up. A short while later he delivered items. There was no sugar and sweetener as requested (I‚Äôd moved so didn‚Äôt have any) - the toasted sandwich was squashed next to the cake, which was warmer than the toastie.I couldn‚Äôt eat any of order and repeated contact attempts resulted in generic messages informing someone would be in touch. This further annoyed me and I asked for a full refund. No reply but 12 hours later, I got an email stating refund‚Ä¶ upon checking I had been refunded ¬£1.25.. not the ¬£16‚Ä¶ nothing I ordered was ¬£1.25 & delivery was free so am unclear what this was.I am clear about contacting my bank to do a charge back and never using Uber Eats again.

I phoned Uber and they only accept calls for people with orders that haven't yet been delivered. Other than that, you need to raise the complaint on line. I downloaded their app but there is no option to raise the complaint as I didn't do my order through their app. So I went to the Uber site. I haven't used the Uber site to order food for at least 2 years and, to be able to raise a complaint, I have to input a code that they have sent to my old email account which I have no way of accessing. I have changed the email to my new email but, again, a code is sent to my old email before they will accept it. I will NEVER order a delivery via Uber again. Nor will I ever order food from McDs again. ¬£6 out of pocket and our food was stone cold. üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°

review: I placed an order to a store that was closed. Apparently they informed Uber they wasn't taking orders, yet my order still went through. When the Uber drive arrived at the store he phoned me and told me it was closed. He then said that I need to cancel the order which I physically couldn't do. But he needed to complete the order to continue working. So I had to confirm delivery for the order because there was no way for me to cancel it. I then couldn't request a refund because I confirmed delivery, after finally being able to email them, they kept responding saying I'm not entitled to a refund. After emailing them many times that all they need to do is phone the store and the delivery guy who would both confirm the store was closed. After eventually drilling through to someone that I paid for a service which I never received, they turned around and eventually refunded me. However, they worded the email in such away to make it seem like I was in the wrong for example "To make things right, I‚Äôve gone ahead and refunded you ¬£25.33 for the entire order as a goodwill gesture.", "Please remember that this is a deviation from our normal policy under these circumstances, so I may not be able to offer the same outcome again in the future." So out the kindness of their hearts they refunded me for a technical mistake that they made. Worst customer service I have ever had to deal with.

When I contacted them, they told me that the ‚Äòdelivery partner‚Äô had called my mobile number multiple times - yet I have no missed calls in my calls list. They said the delivery partner had completed ‚Äòall requirements‚Äô so they would not send a new order and were ‚Äònot authorised to provide a refund‚Äô!!! They have effectively STOLEN my money and think it‚Äôs acceptable to do so!!! I am disgusted this is even allowed to happen!!! SHAME ON YOU UBER EATS. MACDONALDS SHOULD CANCEL YOUR CONTRACTS WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT AND YOU SHOULD BE SUED FOR THEFT.

review: Should give this 0 stars but there‚Äôs not an option for that..So I ordered a McDonald‚Äôs delivery using the McDonald‚Äôs app (it says powered by UberEats). The delivery driver tracker on the app showed him (KAMRAN A was my drivers name) as being outside, had a call from him to say he‚Äôs outside and I told him I‚Äôd be right there (for context I live in shared accommodation so had to make my way to the main door of the building to meet the driver for my food). I reach outside with no one with a delivery to be seen. He then phones back again saying he doesn‚Äôt know where he is, first something about a car park then something about a museum that was further up my street. Explained to him he‚Äôs too far up the street and gave him the name on a sign right opposite where I was and that I knew he‚Äôd be able to see from where he was but he still said he doesn‚Äôt know. Then says ‚ÄúI‚Äôm cancelling your order‚Äù and hung up on me. Tried to call him back but got no answer. It then said ‚Äúorder delivered‚Äù on my McDonald‚Äôs app but no delivery in my possession. Phoned McDonald‚Äôs and they told me to phone Uber Eats, phoned Uber Eats and they told me they cannot refund me or put credit on my Uber account even after explaining the whole situation too them and knowing I should be entitled to a refund due to not receiving what I‚Äôve paid for. DO NOT USE UBER EATS! Whether it‚Äôs the McDonald‚Äôs app, another app they power or the Uber Eats app themselves, their policies are a joke sounds like something a 1 year old would have made up. Just avoid them at all costs!

review: I strongly advise against using UberEats for food delivery. During my recent vacation in Amsterdam, I placed an order for 100 euros, but was dismayed to find that two items were missing, one valued at 25 euros and another at 4 euros.Upon discovering the issue, I promptly contacted UberEats to address the missing items. To my surprise, they only refunded the 4-euro item. Frustrated, I reached out again, specifically inquiring about the 25-euro item, to which they responded, "We already refunded the missing items, and the matter has been resolved."This experience left me utterly perplexed and dissatisfied with their service. Back in my home country, I typically use WOLT, despite its lower rating compared to UberEats. However, WOLT consistently provides excellent customer support, promptly addressing any missing items and ensuring customer satisfaction.It's disheartening to encounter such subpar service from a well-established organization like UberEats. Additionally, their app's interface leaves much to be desired in comparison to their competitors.Given the availability of alternative options, I strongly discourage using UberEats if you're seeking a reliable and responsive food delivery service.Update:They refunded the money now after some discussion, hence abit better rating

Their accents are so thick and they speak so fast you literally can't make out a word they're saying.I've heard numerous stories of uber drivers making off with people's food, selling it on the side and making out they delivered it, but I never expected it to happen to me! review: In addition to exorbitant fees and surcharges, their customer service is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced. Yesterday I opened the app, saw I had a 40% off promo expiring in 2 days. I reached out to support who told me they could not amend an open order but to return once the order as complet. I did just that and I kept getting transferred in the chat to the ‚Äúspecialized department‚Äù. I think I was transfered 5-6 times and they kept transferring me. Ultimately they told me the specialized team would email me back. This morning I got an email simply telling me how to apply a promo code. It‚Äôs like they don‚Äôt read any details and copy and paste generic help from their FAQ. I am livid honestly and am going to cancel and delete Uber and Uber Eats. review: We have had multiple issues over this past year between being overcharged for quoted delivery fees, paying for priority delivery and then watching the driver go off-route into multiple neighborhoods even in opposite directions before coming to us (resulting in our order being 30min or more later than quoted & food cold), not being able to contact support & other difficulties with the app.   However, tonight sealed the deal.  We ordered from a restaurant that we order from almost weekly, and normally due to evening traffic it can take the delivery driver 30-60min to get to us once they‚Äôve picked up.  Never been an issue before.  Well, tonight.  Katelyn picked up our order and AFTER leaving the restaurant with our food, cancels it because it‚Äôs ‚Äútoo far to drive‚Äù.  For 1) as an Uber Eats driver, you can see your entire route prior to accepting it.  So she should‚Äôve thought about that before accepting.  But 2) our bigger problem is that rather than returning the food to the restaurant to be given to another driver, she STOLE our food!  We had to as a result order again, the restaurant had to make it again, and we had to wait another hour+ for our food.   THEN!!!  The driver who picked up our second order attempt texts us after picking it up, complaining about the drive being 20miles (no traffic at this point) and wanting a bigger tip.   No!  You ACCEPTED this order knowing the distance!  And then on top of that, had 4 friends in the car‚Ä¶.one of the friends brought it to our door, not him‚Ä¶and they were all smoking weed that completely smelled up into our home & our food.  So to sum up.   Uber Eats let‚Äôs their drivers steal food & smoke weed & contaminate your food without consequence or compensation to us.  Never again will I use their service.
name: Brandy Huckaby

review: I wish I could give it a zero star rating because when I tried to order food using a promotion code, they charged me the full amount even though the promotion had already been applied to my account. I quickly cancelled the order, but they continued to charge me the full amount. I then contacted customer service to report the issue, and they merely gave me a $10 refund. Never ordering from this app and going to delete the account was a waste of time and money.

review: Uber email eats tempts you with discounts then adds extra fees so that it‚Äôs barely a discount. review: Sadly, Uber Eats customer service is abominable. Uber‚Äôs acquisition of Postmates made this worse. I placed an order through Postmates in March of 2023 (Order 9B99E). They delivered the wrong order, and I let Postmates know immediately, the same day. Postmates refunded / canceled the charge right away. Everything was taken care of quickly and easily.Four months later, in July of 2023, Uber charged my card for the same order. I contacted Uber support right away, and they said they charged my card again because the original charge didn‚Äôt go through. I let them know that the original charge was canceled by Postmates because the original delivered order was wrong. Uber support said that they could not do anything for me, as I contacted them outside of the 48 hour window. I explained to them that I contacted Postmates immediately, on the same day that the wrong order was delivered - That‚Äôs why Postmates refunded / canceled the original charge. Uber support kept reiterating that they could not do anything for me, as I contacted them outside of the 48 hour window.I went back and forth with Uber support for almost three months. Finally, someone from Uber priority support was able to credit my account for the charge in October of 2023. It absolutely should not have taken that long to rectify the situation. It almost seemed like Uber did not have access to the old Postmates records. In any case, it was some of the worst customer service that I‚Äôve ever received from any company.
name: Jason

review: It was a great experience. I was at work and I was able to send my daughter and her three friends, a smoothie, where they just needed to go out and retrieve as it was paid for on Uber eats. review: Hey UberEats crew,First off, gotta give props to UberEats for helpin' me make that dough. Seriously, thanks for the opportunity to earn some extra cash. You guys rock!Now, let me drop some feedback that's constructive but friendly, ya know? First things first, I gotta say, the tablet for accepting orders is legit. It's so easy to use, like a piece of cake. I can easily see and handle all the orders like a boss. It's hella smooth, and it helps me hustle faster.Oh, and shoutout to you guys for makin' menu changes a breeze. I've had to tweak my menu before, and damn, it's so damn easy on UberEats. Other platforms be playin' with complicated steps and confusing layouts, but UberEats keeps it real simple and straightforward. I can make changes in a snap, savin' me loads of precious time.Lastly, keep up the friendly and humorous vibe. Sometimes, the order game can be a bit of a challenge, but your customer service peeps always handle it with a cool and funny attitude. It makes me feel like a VIP, yo. That's the kind of vibe that keeps me rollin' with UberEats.Once again, big thanks for all your hard work. You guys are the real MVPs. Keep hustlin'!Peace out!

review: I have been a loyal Uber Eats customer for several years. Often spending hundreds of dollars at once, tipping on every order, and a customer who meets the driver near their vehicle to avoid the driver wasting significant time coming to my door. I have reported only two issues in the 5 years I have been soley an Unver Eats customer. I am no longer an Unber Eats customer as of today. Today I ordered from a local restaurant and the UberEats App responded that there was an error and my order had not been sent. I made a second identical order and waited for the food to be delivered. Upon delivery, the driver brought two of the same order. Upon checking the UberEats application I see I was charged for both orders and tipped the driver twice. I contacted UberEats and informed them of the issue. Despite my several attempts to explain that the error occurred only because information I received from their App they refused to reimburse me for even half of the order. UberEats just lost a very committed customer. I have not used or explored other food delivery apps but will move on after this experience.

review: DO NOT USE I ordered and an item was missing. A pumpkin Spice Latte. It was the only reason I made the order but I added a few bits to make the order worthwhile. I don‚Äôt have a lot of money. I was made homeless after abuse and I was down. I wanted to treat myself So I tried to contact the driver first thinking he may have forgot the bag. I had two bags that had on them 1/3 and 2/3 suggesting there should be 3/3. He didn‚Äôt answer. So I went through the order connection thing to advise of missing item. After robot templates for 2 days where I just went round and round in circles, being told no refund will be allowed in this case and then going round in circles again, I finally got a human response. Yet they still wouldn‚Äôt give me a refund for ¬£3. You may think let it go it‚Äôs only ¬£3. But that‚Äôs a lot to someone recovering from losing everything. And I actually paid over ¬£20 in the end for this order as I bought some extra bits. I was down and wanted a treat. They knew this as I advised them of it. I‚Äôm also going through an investigation for CA and so I needed a little bit of joy. (They also knew this in the end because I basically broke down verbally)For a huge company to be so petty to not give a very down woman ¬£3 or whatever the coffee was, is actually disgraceful. I did all they asked. Contacted driver. Provided pics of the bags I had. But how do you take a pic of a non item. A missing item? It‚Äôs almost accusing me of lying. I won‚Äôt ever use them again. There‚Äôs no heart or compassion. They should be seriously ashamed of their ‚Äúcustomer service‚Äù.
